title: How to Prepare Organic Pesticides   Year 2022

subtasks: Collecting materials (aloe vera, red pepper, marigold, tomato leaves, onion leaves, red pepper)
Pound and chop the materials to release their active ingredients
Mix the pounded materials in a container with water (10 liters for this example)
Allow the mixture to sit for three days to allow decomposition and release of active ingredients (decoction)
Strain the mixture to separate solids from the liquid solution
Apply the solution to crops as a natural pesticide
Gather aloe vera, red pepper, marigold leaves, tomato leaves, onion leaves, and water
Crush aloe vera, red pepper, marigold leaves, tomato leaves, and onion leaves using a mortar and pestle or chopping
Combine crushed materials in a large container
Add enough water (10 liters in this case) to cover the crushed materials
Seal the container and let it sit undisturbed for 3 days to allow decomposition and release of active compounds
Strain the liquid through a cheesecloth or fine mesh sieve to remove solid particles
Dilute the concentrate if necessary and spray on crops or pour around plants
